columns.Stadium_ID: A unique identifier for each stadium in the database.
columns.Location: The geographical area where the stadium is situated.
columns.Name: The official name of the stadium.
columns.Capacity: The maximum number of spectators that the stadium can accommodate.
columns.Highest: The highest recorded attendance at the stadium.
columns.Lowest: The lowest recorded attendance at the stadium.
columns.Average: The average attendance at the stadium over a specified period.

stadium.table_description: The stadium table stores information about various stadiums, including their identifiers, locations, names, attendance capacities, and historical attendance records.

columns.Singer_ID: A unique identifier for each singer in the database.
columns.Name: The name of the singer.
columns.Country: The country where the singer is from.
columns.Song_Name: The title of the song associated with the singer.
columns.Song_release_year: The year in which the song was released.
columns.Is_male: A boolean indicating whether the singer is male (True) or not (False).

singer.table_description: The singer table contains information about various singers, including their identity, nationality, song details, demographics, and gender.

columns.concert_ID: A unique identifier for each concert entry in the database.
columns.concert_Name: The title or name of the concert event.
columns.Theme: The specific theme or concept that the concert is based around.
columns.Stadium_ID: A reference identifier indicating the stadium where the concert is held.
columns.Year: The year in which the concert takes place.

concert.table_description: The concert table contains information about various concert events, including their identifiers, names, themes, locations, and the years they occur.

columns.concert_ID: This column represents the unique identifier for each concert in which a singer performs.
columns.Singer_ID: This column represents the unique identifier for each singer participating in the concerts.

singer_in_concert.table_description: The singer_in_concert table captures the relationship between singers and the concerts they are associated with, identifying each concert and the respective singers performing in them.
